data.enText: a space or hole that sb/sth can pass through

data.chText: 我们从屋顶的小洞能看见星星。
data.enText: We could see the stars through an opening in the roof.
the beginning or first part of sth
The movie has an exciting opening.
a ceremony to celebrate the start of a public event or the first time a new building, road, etc. is used

data.chText: 奥林匹克运动会开幕式
data.enText: the opening of the Olympic Games
the official opening of the new hospital
the act or process of making sth open or of becoming open
the opening of a flower
the opening of the new play

data.chText: 现在超市不按时开门在英国司空见惯。
data.enText: Late opening of supermarkets is common in Britain now.
a job that is available
There are several openings in the sales department.
a good opportunity for sb

data.chText: 在这次比赛中获胜是她未来事业发展的良好开端。
data.enText: Winning the competition was the opening she needed for her career.
part of a piece of clothing that is made to open and close so that it can be put on easily
The skirt has a side opening.
first; beginning
his opening remarks
the opening chapter of the book

data.text: job ♦ post ♦ position ♦ vacancy ♦ placement ♦ appointment ♦ opening

data.chText: 以上各词均表示工作、职位。
data.enText: These are all words for a position doing work for which you receive regular payment.
job
a position doing work for which you receive regular payment

data.chText: 他正设法在银行找一个工作。
data.enText: He's trying to get a job in a bank.
post

data.chText: 指职位，尤指大机构的要职：
data.enText: a job, especially an important one in a large organization
a key post in the new government
position
( rather formal ) a job

data.chText: 在一家大公司的高级职务
data.enText: a senior position in a large corporation

data.chText: position通常指机构中的职位，尤指高级职位，通常不用以指一般的工作。该词亦常用于工作申请、职位说明和招聘广告中。
data.enText: Position usually refers to a particular job within an organization, especially at a high level, and is not usually used about jobs generally. It is also often used in job applications, descriptions and advertisements.
job or position?
vacancy
a job that is available for sb to do

data.chText: 我们有几个临时工的空缺。
data.enText: We have several vacancies for casual workers.
placement
( BrE ) a job, often as part of a course of study, in which you get experience of a particular type of work

data.chText: 在一家计算机公司的暑期实习
data.enText: a summer placement with a computer firm
appointment

data.chText: 指承担一定责任的职务、职位：
data.enText: ( rather formal , especially BrE ) a job or position of responsibility

data.chText: 这是一个固定职位，需要专心致志和勤奋工作。
data.enText: This is a permanent appointment, requiring commitment and hard work.
opening
a job that is available for sb to do
There are several openings in the sales department.

data.chText: 以上两词意思相同，用法上没什么区别。vacancy较常用，尤其是在英国英语中。opening较非正式，较多用于美国英语和财经报刊中。
data.enText: These words have the same meaning and there is very little difference in their use. Vacancy is more frequent, especially in British English. Opening is slightly more informal and is used more in American English and in financial journalism.
vacancy or opening?
a permanent/temporary job/post/position/vacancy/placement/appointment/opening
a full-time/part-time job/post/position/vacancy/placement/appointment/opening
to have/have got a(n) job/post/position/vacancy/placement/appointment/opening
to apply for a job/post/position/vacancy/placement
to hold a(n) job/post/position/appointment
to fill a(n) job/post/position/vacancy/appointment/opening
to resign from/leave/quit a job/post/position

tr: the first of a series of actions

example: the ray of light revealed his cautious opening of the door

tr: becoming open or being made open
example: the opening of his arms was the sign I was waiting for

tr: a recognized sequence of moves at the beginning of a game of chess
example: he memorized all the important chess openings

tr: an entrance equipped with a hatch
especially a passageway between decks of a ship
a vacant or unobstructed space that is man-made
example: they left a small opening for the cat at the bottom of the door

tr: an aperture or hole that opens into a bodily cavity
example: the orifice into the aorta from the lower left chamber of the heart

tr: the initial part of the introduction
example: the opening established the basic theme

tr: the first performance (as of a theatrical production)
example: the opening received good critical reviews

tr: a ceremony accompanying the start of some enterprise
an open or empty space in or between things
example: there was a small opening between the trees
the explosion made a gap in the wall

tr: opportunity especially for employment or promotion
example: there is an opening in the sales department
the memorable opening bars of Beethoven's Fifth

value.def: The opening event, item, day, or week in a series is the first one.

example.ex: They returned to take part in the season's opening game.
example.tran: 他们回来参加本赛季的开幕赛。

example.ex: ...the opening day of the fifth General Synod.

value.def: The opening of something such as a book, play, or concert is the first part of it.

example.ex: The opening of the scene depicts Akhnaten and his family in a moment of intimacy.
example.tran: 这幕戏的开场描绘了埃及法老阿肯那顿和他的家人其乐融融的情景。

value.def: An opening is a hole or empty space through which things or people can pass.

example.ex: He squeezed through a narrow opening in the fence.
example.tran: 他从围栏上的狭窄缺口里挤了过去。

value.def: An opening in a forest is a small area where there are no trees or bushes.

example.ex: I glanced down at the beach as we passed an opening in the trees.
example.tran: 我们经过一块林中空地时，我往下扫了一眼海滩。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 clearing

value.def: An opening is a good opportunity to do something, for example to show people how good you are.

example.ex: Her capabilities were always there; all she needed was an opening to show them.
example.tran: 她一直都很有能力；她需要的只是一次展示才华的机会。

value.def: An opening is a job that is available.

example.ex: We don't have any openings now, but we'll call you if something comes up.
example.tran: 我们现在没有职位空缺，一旦有的话我们会给你打电话。

trans: 解禁；开放；供开发；启用；落成
开张；开幕；正式开业；隆重开幕；隆重开业
（信用状）开状银行，（信用证）开证银行
开幕之夜；(戏剧的)首夜演出；(电影的)首夜放映
开幕辞；开幕致辞；开幕词；开幕致词；开场白
开门尺寸；门框尺寸；车门开启；门开口；门洞
